intro: Helogyne calocephala, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, or white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its beauty and resilience.
